newsitem.title: UNITED NATIONS: U.N. announces program to back "good governance".
newsitem.headline: U.N. announces program to back "good governance".

text.p: The U.N. Development Programme (UNDP) on Monday announced a $36 million pilot programme to promote "good governance" in developing nations.

UNDP administrator James Speth said more than 75 countries would receive assistance through programmes in such areas as strengthening judicial systems and parliaments, human rights, decentralization and trade.
He told a news conference that "governance" included not only government but civil society and a vibrant private sector.
The four-year project will test new ideas and approaches in the developing world and support activities by partners such as civic organisations, media, human rights groups and parliaments.

The programme was announced at the start of a three-day international conference on governance for sustainable growth and equity attended by more than 1,000 governmment ministers, parliamentarians, mayors and representatives of media, business and development bodies.
